On Thu, 2003-07-31 at 21:20, Adam Jack wrote:

> Ok, another example. I have a class that walks a classpath and generates
> listener events on things found, I test that. I have a class that listens to
> such events to "find" things that match a certain criterion, I test that. If
> the first class fails to send events, then I ought not blame (or dig into)
> the second for not finding anything. The tests are (I believe) unit tests of
> each, without duplication.
Ok, here,  The first class, the classpath walker, is fine.  However, the
second class should use a mockobject version of the classpathwalker. 
ClasspathWalker should be an interface.  This way you can test your own
reaction to fake events.  Ones which you control and aren't dependent on
the classpath walker OR ON THE CLASSES IN THE PATH.
-- 
David Boyer <mangr3n@...>
